welcome.title: Welcome to Stemux!
welcome.description: Stemux is a multi-track audio player designed for musicians who want to practice with isolated stems. Load your tracks, control volumes independently, and create loop regions for focused practice.

basics.title: Getting Started
basics.uploadDesc: Drag and drop audio files (MP3, WAV, OGG, etc.) or click the upload area. Your tracks are stored locally in your browser.
basics.playbackDesc: Use the floating play/pause button or press SPACE to control playback. Adjust playback speed from 0.25x to 4.0x for practice at your own pace.

tracks.title: Track Controls
tracks.soloShort: Short press: Solo this track (mute all others)
tracks.soloLong: Long press: Exclusive solo (unmute all + solo only this track)
tracks.volumeDesc: Each track has its own volume slider. There's also a master volume control in the bottom bar.

loops.title: Loop System
loops.openDesc: Click the loop button (top-right corner) to open the loop controls. The timeline shows your audio progress.
loops.setStep1: 1. Start playback and click 'Mark Loop Start' at the desired starting point
loops.setStep2: 2. Continue playing and click 'Mark Loop End' at the desired ending point
loops.setStep3: 3. The loop is automatically enabled. Toggle it on/off or clear it using the controls.
loops.activeDesc: When a loop is active, playback automatically returns to the start point when reaching the end. Perfect for practicing difficult sections!

tips.title: Tips & Tricks
tips.tip1: Click on track names to rename them
tips.tip2: Files are saved in your browser - no internet required after loading
tips.tip3: Use the skip button to return to loop start (or track start if no loop)
tips.tip4: Combine solo and loop to focus on specific instruments in specific sections
